triples.name: XGBoost
triples.relevance: The paper uses XGBoost as the optimal machine learning model for customer churn prediction, achieving 97% accuracy.

triples.name: Shapley value
triples.relevance: SHAP values are used to interpret the predictive model and analyze the correlation between features and customer churn.

triples.name: Causal inference
triples.relevance: R-learner causal inference method is applied to explore the causal impacts of variables on customer churn.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper combines multiple machine learning methods to build a comprehensive customer churn prediction model.

triples.name: Customer attrition
triples.relevance: Customer churn prediction for credit card customers is the core task addressed by the paper.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: Sampling techniques are used to balance the data before building the churn prediction model.

triples.name: Gradient boosting
triples.relevance: Gradient boosting is the underlying technique behind XGBoost used for the final predictive model.

triples.name: Explainable artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Model interpretability using SHAP is a key aspect of the paper's methodology for explaining churn predictions.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel comprehensive customer churn prediction model combining XGBoost, SHAP interpretation, and R-learner causal inference.
